Art. 4.210. 
Increase between legatees 
There is an increase in favour of the legatees where the legacy is made to several persons jointly.
 The legacy is deemed to be made jointly, where it is made by one and the same disposition, and the testator has not assigned the share of each of the joint legatees in the property bequeathed.
 It is also deemed to have been made jointly where property which cannot be divided without deterioration has been bequeathed by the same will to several persons, even separately.
